creator: katkere@praja.com
text:
Jasper does not look at the apps classloader (lib/apps and 
org.apache.tomcat.apps.classloader) while compiling the JSPs. Classes from apps 
classloader is available to the compiled JSPs when accessed via introspection 
API.

To reproduce, place any jar file (say, mail.jar from JavaMail). Access any 
class from it using page import. E.g.,

<%@ page import="javax.mail.Address"%>

This results in an error message.

Replace this with:

<%=Class.forName("javax.mail.Address"%>

and it works as expected.

Which shows Jasper is using the wrong classpath to compile the JSPs.

Workaround is to use the common classloader, but we hear talks of more 
classloaders (for groups of webapps), and please keep Jasper in sync with these 
excellent changes.

This won't be addressed in Tomcat 3.2.2.  It will be evaluated for a later 
release.
